Equatorial Guinea

For supplementary information, see links to post office home pages here , to postal code pages here and to other personal name and addressing issues pages here .

Equatorial Guinea - Country information

Equatorial Guinea - Number format

Note: This section last updated 14th April 2021

In French and Portuguese:

1 234,45

(where , indicates the decimal separator and a space the thousands separator)

In Spanish:

1.234,45

(where , indicates the decimal separator and . the thousands separator)

Equatorial Guinea - Date and time formats

Equatorial Guinea - Languages

The national language, Spanish , is spoken by some 2.3% of the population. Fang (originating in the mainland, Rio Munde) is spoken by 75% of the population. Other languages are Balenque , Benga , Bube (originating on the main island, Bioko), Crioulo , Krio , Ngumba , Ngumbi , Seki and Yasa .

Equatorial Guinea - Post office box

This is written as Apartado.

Equatorial Guinea - Postal codes

Equatorial Guinea has no postal code system.
